verses.roman:
pratyakṣa tāṅhāra tapta-kāñcanera dyuti
yāṅhāra chaṭāya nāśe ajñāna-tamastati

synonyms: pratyakṣa—vivid; tāṅhāra—of Him; tapta—molten; kāñcanera—of gold; dyuti—effulgence; yāṅhāra—of whom; chaṭāya—by the luster; nāśe—destroys; ajñāna—of ignorance; tamastati—the extent of the darkness.
translation: One can vividly see His glowing complexion of molten gold, which dispels the darkness of ignorance.
